question: How you holdin' up?
answer: Freezing my nuts off.

question: *Put that away*. I can't take it, Earl, this dumb costume is giving me a wedgie. Driving me crazy, but there's these *kids* here --

question: In front of little Billy, age four, yeah. "Look, Mommy, Mrs. Claus chooses to go butt-mining."

question: Age four, kid's unbelievable. I'm too old for this, Earl.

question: Say that a little louder, there's a kid in back didn't catch it.
answer: It's not that fucking little Billy again, is it?

question: Eight years. I keep hiring detectives, but they never find anything. I was born 3000 days ago on the beach in New Jersey. I entered the world fully grown, wearing clothes I don't remember buying. Nothing in the pockets but a single key, filed smooth. I'm married now. Nice guy, early forties. I stand naked in the mirror and try to guess my age. Thirty-five, maybe. I have lots of scars. Hal, I gotta tell you, of all the Christmas pageants I've seen, this was by far the most recent.
answer: Aw, honey, I had teenage girls playing the wise men, what'd you expect?

question: Teenage boys?
answer: Well, I thought they did fine.

question: You're married what now, five years...? You and Hal, how often you two...?
answer: Stick our fingers in out hands and pull them out again? Every chance we get. Shut your piehole.

question: Don't get all snippy...
answer: Earl, do me a favor. Every few words say "hic" and have bubbles come out your mouth, okay?

question: Please, man... I don't know why you gotta kill me... But use the gun, not the knife. Please. As a fucking favor, I'm begging you...
answer: It'll be over soon.

question: Jesus, man... I... I'm scared of the knife... Shit, I can't handle getting shots at the doctors, man, PLEASE...!
answer: Last chance. What do you know about a town called Santa Claus?

question: What is this, *what the fuck is this*?? I'm FBI, for Chrissake, you can't do this to me. I don't know
answer: No. You don't. I can always tell, you know... If someone's lying to me. A little skill of mine, something to trot out at parties. Timothy.

question: No. You don't. I can always tell, you know... If someone's lying to me. A little skill of mine, something to trot out at parties. Timothy.
answer: Message from Mr. Daedalus.

question: I'm listening.
answer: He says he's sorry, but he needs you right away. Something's come up.

question: Nix. I'm just finishing up here. Then I'm going bunjee jumping.
answer: He's aware of your weekend plans, and he apologizes.

question: All right, what's so fucking important?
answer: Your old colleague, One-Eyed Jack...? Recently escaped from a high-security prison, as you're aware. But listen to this

answer: The man was overheard talking to himself under sedation. He said Charly Baltimore's alive, sir.

question: *Allez, Gumby etiriait le cou, fils de pute*. I speak French. You bet your life, fluent French, whatever the fuck that means. Quand j'tais a l'ecole, Jai eu un professeur qui s'est fabriqu du dentifrice! Right, he was, you got a problem with that? Pasty Joe, we called him. Look, the accent's perfect, so piss off. I'M A FRENCH CHEF, YA-HOO.
answer: Put Perkins in the basket. He's luck.

question: Mr. Perkins, going in the basket.
answer: Are the training wheels off?

question: Just pretend they're still there. Piece of cake. You can do it.
answer: Wait...! I'm scared.

question: Shhh. Nothing to be scared of. Pretend you're one of the X-men, you're tough. Let's go, now. Three, two, one...

question: Nonsense. You can do it. You don't want to, but you can.
answer: My arm hurts, please take me home...!

question: You can go home, Caitlin. You can ride there.
answer: Mom, no...!

question: Look, I know you're afraid, that's the whole *point*, can you see that? Now stop being a little baby and get on the damn bike. You gonna be afraid of things all your life? Huh? That what you want?
answer: My wrist hurts...!

question: Life is pain. Get used to it. See, you *will* ride this bike home, princess. You will ride it and you will not fall again, *is that understood*...? Yes, I'm three blocks past the gas station... Right. Thank you Mr. Henessey, I'll see you shortly.
answer: She rode all the way home. She didn't fall, not once. She didn't cry. You're good. You should work with kids, you know that?

question: She said her wrist hurt. I didn't know it was broken, God. I can't even remember what I said to her...!
answer: We can still make six o'clock mass, you coming?

question: A private detective's coming by, he... he's found something. I may have to go away. For a bit. Now please leave me alone.
answer: Go away. With a detective. Jesus, it's the holidays, Sam --

question: "Movin' in."
answer: Hah?

question: It's not linen. The song's not about linen.
answer: Whatever. You cold?

question: I'm freezing.
answer: Turn on the heater. It doesn't work, but it makes a very annoying noise which distracts from the cold.

question: I'll pass. So, you're a former cop. Atlanta, was it...? Stop me if I'm out of line, but I'm curious. How did you... well, succeed? I mean, where six other detectives failed?
answer: You kidding? Pure luck. Plus my secretary used her feminine wiles. She's got two, one wile per side. Huge. No kidding, you can see 'em coming around a corner, you got time to comb your hair. Nice kid, you'd dig her. Ah. Here we are. Putting my glasses in my cooooat..." I sing what I do so I'll remember it. "Turning off the downstairs liiiight..." You know? Do me a favor. Say, "Always after me Lucky Charms." Thanks. Just needed to hear that. See anything you recognize?

question: Yeah, this dirt used to be outside my window, shut up and let me look. I'm sorry, Mr. Henessey, I'm a little on edge. I can feel her. Like a ghost. We could walk away, you know. There's still time, we could just... leave her dead. Ay-i-yi! Size four, no way. You know how long it's been since I could wear a size four? Can't be mine. Can they...?
answer: Unmailed envelope. Addressed to a guy.

question: What's in it?
answer: Another guy's address. Two addresses, is basically what I'm saying. Anything else in there?

question: Hmm...? Uh, no. Just... more clothes.
answer: Yeah, well take a look at this.

question: Alice, please...? Your dog, Alice. It and my appetite are mutually exclusive. It's simple. He's been licking his asshole for three straight hours. I submit to you that there's nothing there worth more than an hour's attention, and I should think whatever he's attempting to dislodge is either gone for good or there to stay. *Wouldn't you agree*? Hello?
answer: Hello, Mr. Windeman, I got this number from a realtor in Pennsylvania. I'd like to speak with you.

question: Who... who is this?
answer: You tell me, Mr. Windeman.

question: ...Charly...?
answer: My full name, please.

question: God, it really is you...!? Chapter, they think you're dead, *everyone* thinks --
answer: *My full name*. Please...!

question: Go up this hill.
answer: Why?

question: *Drive up the fucking hill*.
answer: Where the shit did you get that? Sam, Goddammit, you're gonna kill someone! Hey! The diner...? That's half a mile away, are you fucking crazy?

question: HK M-40 assault rifle. At three hundred yards, vertical drop six inches. Shit. He's gonna do the girl.
answer: How the fuck can you tell?

question: Aw, cut me a break, Fran. I been out eight months, I'm back doing skip traces, now you got me stealing fuckin' bicycles?
answer: I still can't believe it. You're saying my hands didn't even shake...? What's the matter with you?

question: You. You're the matter. Look, you wanna keep going, good luck. I'm driving back to Ohio. You're free to come with me.
answer: What... what are you telling me?

question: Goddammit, lady, I'm taking you *home*.
answer: I'll spell it out for you, ready? I have no future, *I can't go home*. Until I know what's happening, I'm in *prison*, you know how that feels...?

question: Yeah, matter of fact. Four years inside. Marion, Illinois, real shithole. Get in the car.
answer: I'm sorry. Um... what did you...?

question: Seven years ago, Atlanta PD. Me and my partner, we handled a lot of impounded shit. Fucker hated me, boy. One weekend, when he was conveniently gone...? Some bearer bonds disappeared from his office. And lo and behold, when the police responded to an anonymous tip, you'll never guess what just happened to be sitting in my closet.
answer: The bonds. Your partner put them there?

question: Hell no, I did, I stole the fucking things. Now every dollar I hand my kid, he asks his mother did I steal it. No more killing.
answer: No more killing. It was a helluva shot, wasn't it..." Quarter til. Any time now.

question: Nice crowd.

question: Who wouldn't be? Corner booth, there's a beaut. While you're doing her doggie- style you can pop the zits on her back.
answer: I just... got a flash of something,

question: Whoa. You remember your father?
answer: No... that's what's strange. If I saw him on the street, I... I wouldn't... oh.

question: Ms. Caine, last week at a party I ran into a girl I knew from college and we chatted for a few minutes. And it wasn't til I was driving home on the freeway that I remembered that I'd screwed her in the back of a car once. Everyone forgets.
answer: That's it? That's your helpful story? Jesus Christ!

question: No, see, all's I'm saying is you're not alone.
answer: Oh, shut up.

question: For you. Another in a long line of bad investments.

question: Just saw the ring on your finger. Do I know you from somewhere...? Whoa. Back up. Total pickup line, let's forget I said that.
answer: Thanks for the drink. But no. I don't know you.

question: No, you don't, do you...? I'd know if you did. I can tell if someone's lying. Sorry to bother you. Okay, people, I got what I needed. Wait until she comes out. Then do them both. Walk soft, we got local law.

question: What are you doing?

question: So now you're a sharpshooter?

question: Mr. Windeman...? Oh, SHIT!

question: Charly. Jesus Christ, I don't believe what I'm seeing, you're so *fat*.

question: What in God's hell have you been *eating*, you look positively bovine! Hang on.

question: Bulletproof. Put it in myself. Charlene, darling --

question: Yes, yes, you said that on the phone. *Must* I point out to you that the letters in the name SAM CAINE, when rearranged, spell out AMNESIAC? Your memory was gone, you got confused and you BOUGHT YOUR OWN COVER. This ridiculous Ohio housewife business, it's a fantasy, you *wrote* the bloody thing!

question: Lucky bastard found the only cool car in the fucking midwest. Your father was in the British SIS, assigned to the Irish situation. After he was murdered in 1971, his friend Perkins recruited you for Chapter, a black bag operation working out of the U.S. State Department. Fall, 1987
answer: Would you lay off the weight?

question: I think we can safely assume Daedalus is aware of your resurrection and is attempting to reverse it. *Damn*, I can't drive around in this thing. Any idea where we can go to stash this car?

question: Perhaps you'd best drive.
answer: Don't be afraid, we don't want to hurt you. I just want to know who you are.

question: This is ridiculous. What do we do with this guy?

question: It's possible.
answer: And you kid, Cathead --

question: Caitlin.

question: I'm about to faint... And if you call an ambulance, I will fucking kill you. Where's Charly...?

question: Goddammit, I told you --

question: Sod that... just watch them.
answer: Don't worry about it. Chick signs my checks, I'm gonna watch her get aced? Lie back down.

question: Checks. You're not fooling anyone, dear boy. You'd wash her feet and drink the water... wouldn't you?
answer: Cut me a break, nimrod. She's married with a kid.

question: My star pupil... That man in Pennsylvania yesterday... The one at the diner, that was hers, wasn't it...?
answer: How'd you know?

question: I saw the news report, they found a shell casing a thousand yards away, helluva shot.

question: Arms broker, man without a face. Veteran of Baader-Meinhoff and the Red Brigades. He's rumored to be based in the U.S. Doesn't travel much, they say. Too afraid of metal detectors, the poor sod's got a foot- long piece of steel in his leg.

question: A pin, Mr. Henessey. A surgical pin.

question: You blithering idiot, the son of a bitch wasn't her lover, he was her target, he's Daedalus!

question: You've never made it with a boy, then?
answer: There's nothing odd about it. I'm only sixteen.

question: Rubbish.
answer: What?

question: You're fourteen and not a day more. Here now, I'm right, you're blushing.
answer: Look, what if I'm ignorant? It's my father, we never stay in one place, I never meet bloody anyone.

question: Saw him on the telly. Think he'd kill me? I'm a nasty one, I am. You know what, I'll bet you've never even kissed a boy... now, have you? Aye, but you want to... Thanks for shutting off the alarm, you bloody Papist bitch. Tell the press the Ulster Force claims full credit.
answer: *DA*!

question: It's not that I don't trust my compatriot, Colonel Baltimore. In fact, I had every confidence that your amnesia was genuine -- until you showed up *here*. You follow? Meanwhile, I just got around to reading the papers, there's the small matter of an incident upstate. Long range rifle shot, blew a man out of his socks. You can see where I'm coming from. I'm trying to pull of the biggest job of my career. I have to know. How much you really remember... and who you've told.
answer: I didn't tell a soul, I swear.

question: We'll soon know.
answer: Is... is this a torture thing...?

question: Torture, yes. The torturing of beautiful women, albeit politically incorrect, is an addiction with me. A woman never looks quite so beautiful as when her face is distended in pain. Witness the beauty of childbirth.

question: Let's not, and say we did. Do you smoke?

question: Good. You'll last longer. Now hush yourself, and take a deep breath. We're gonna do the torture thing.

question: Juice up the bird, we head out soon as I'm done here. Take all the air you can, that's right. If you need to vomit, do it now.

question: Talk to me Colonel. Is my identity safe...? The truth, and I'll shoot you in the head. Nice and quick. Otherwise, you're in for a long night. *Who did you talk to*?
answer: ...Nobody... fuck you...

question: Hate to see you like this, Charly. I heard you were a helluva spy once.
answer: Watch your back. I'm not done yet.

question: *You*...! Are you crazy, coming here??

question: What...?
answer: Your rogue bitch just took him out. Probably went shopping in his weapons storage too. We're still on, Perkins. I've got the tanker, the chemist, all ready to go... but you gotta contain her, man. We gotta step on her hard and fast.

question: Who is it? Perkins.
answer: It's cold, I want to come in.

question: Charly...? Oh, my God, what the hell are you *doing*? Listen to me, I'm going to direct you to a safe house, get you on a plane --
answer: Can the bullshit, I'm not telling you where I am. I'll come in for a full debriefing, but we do it my way.

question: Charly, you're being paranoid. It's not like it used to be, you're eight years out of date.
answer: Do tell.

question: Congress won't authorize a dime, Charly. Chapter's on the way out, we've been reduced to a records- keeping agency, we *don't have enough money to kill you*, understand...?
answer: Fuck you, Perkins. If you want me dead, you'll pass a hat in the typing pool to buy bullets. We do things my way.

question: Your way, I see. And if I say go to hell?
answer: From where I stand, it ain't much of a commute. You'll hear from me.

question: She mustn't threaten our success. Contain her, whatever it takes. But be *careful*. If it gets out you're working for me... we'll both be grabbing our ankles on the White House lawn.
answer: Hey, Mitch. Glad you're awake. Uh- oh, you're seeping. Here, look at this.

question: Hey, Mitch. Glad you're awake. Uh- oh, you're seeping. Here, look at this.
answer: Ah, that hurt like shit!!

question: That's why I distracted you first. Same principle as breaking in virgins.
answer: Same as -- virgins, *what*...?

question: Saw it in a Harold Robbins book. Guy bites her on the ear as he goes in. Distracts from the pain. You ever try that?
answer: No, I slug 'em in the jaw and yell "pop goes the weasel," what the fuck are you talking about? Who are you??

question: Name's Charly. The spy. Nice to meet'cha. Drink? See? Sit next to the dance floor, every drink's free. People finish dancing, they think the waiter lifted 'em.
answer: I'm confused. Gimme a minute.

question: Take two, they're small.
answer: Okay. Let's say I buy it. You're actually a trained killer, Jesus, I can't even say it with a straight face. So then... Samantha, she...

question: Never really existed. Like Nathan said, she was a total fabrication, I made her up.
answer: Fabrication. And now she's just... gone? Forever and ever?

question: Thank God. Look at my inordinately large ass, look what she did to me.
answer: Pretty convincing act.

question: Guess so.
answer: I mean, her personality, it had to come from *somewhere* --

question: Change the subject. Better yet, steal me another drink.
answer: Drink up. What's next?

question: I called Chapter. I'm trying to bring us in from the field alive...
answer: Chapter. Can you trust them?

question: Not sure. Until I know, you might wanna stay away from curbs. They like to push people in front of buses. If I could come that way I wouldn't need to dance the lambada. Follow me, I need you to do something.
answer: ...The lady's whacked, Trin, she's lost it and I want fucking out, now *call the Feds*. She's moving us tonight, I'll sneak out to this phone, call you back at midnight with the details. All right, Charly. What did that accomplish?

question: I'm testing our boy Perkins. I figure he's gotta be tapping your office. Got a light...?
answer: Oh, no. He just traced that call?

question: Come midnight, you hang by the phone. Nobody shows, we think about trusting him. He tries to kidnap and torture you, well, there it is.
answer: Whoa, time out.

question: Oh, don't be such a baby. Ten o'clock, we got two hours to kill. I'm a woman, feed me. Ugh. God I'm full, I'm gonna have a food baby.
answer: "Charly." fucking unbelievable. Shame about the fat ass. I bet you were really attractive once.

question: Oh, I was. Check this out. One time? A guy said he'd fuck me.
answer: No.

question: Swear to God.
answer: Did he make good?

question: Absolutely. Oh, and afterwards? Oh my God, afterwards I said the most funny thing, you know what I said...? I said, "Go back to your room. Dad..." It's why he thought I had him killed.
answer: Your father was murdered.

question: When Da died, I went to his funeral. 12 years old, today I wouldn't. And I overheard a woman, she was praying... She was thanking God -- sounded so happy -- thanking Him it hadn't been *her* father who was killed. See... she didn't really care that God had let someone die... just so long as it missed *her*. ...and she bought her cross at the same store as mine, see, that's what we do, we all pray to the same cross on a hundred different walls, and sit back and wait to see who gets hit and who gets missed. Fuck the waiting. Fuck being afraid. I determine who gets hit, and how hard. And I thank no one. It's pathetic to thank someone who spares you -- when they're just taking someone else. Walk me upstairs? This is my first date in eight years, Mitch. Is this a fun date...?
answer: Okay, what's going on?

question: True love, shut the fuck up.
answer: You kidding me? I'm an ex-con, lady. I wear a shiny suit, my tie's crooked, and the last time I got blown candy bars cost a nickel. Plus I'm ugly, so what's up?

question: Chemistry. Be quiet.
answer: Chemistry my ass. Know what I think? I think this is why you'd fuck me. To kill a schoolteacher. Bury any trace of her. Sorry, I liked the schoolteacher. When she comes back, give me a call. Oh, and call your fuckin' kid, will ya'? It's two days to Christmas, and she's under the mistaken impression that Mommy gives a shit.

question: I didn't ask for the kid, Mitch. Samantha had the kid, not me, NOBODY Easy, baby. She ain't coming back, no way. Bitch is dead.
answer: Good evening.

question: Fuck off.
answer: I see me a good-looking lady, all upset, I wonder if she doesn't need some male company.

question: Forget it. I'm saving myself 'til I get raped.
answer: Step into the alley, honey. I ain't asking, I'm telling.

question: Oh, don't tell me. You're early, Goddammit, you're supposed to be at the pay phone. Go away and come back at midnight. I'm not ready yet. Got a light?
answer: Lady, I have a gun!

question: What the hell are you doing here?
answer: Saving your life. Woulda got here sooner but I was thinking up the sandwich line.

question: You think I couldn't take him? *Idiot*, you probably scared the other guy away --
answer: What other guy -- ?

question: Headhunters, nimrod, they go in pairs, were you always this stupid or did you take lessons?
answer: Hey!

question: *What*?
answer: I still got this fucking gun!

question: No, you don't.
answer: SHIIIIT!!

question: Fuck you. Just fuck all of you. Dammit. I knew I couldn't trust that prick. Easy, Spike. I got myself out of Beirut once, I think I can get us out of New Jersey.

question: Good point.
answer: Dear Mom

question: Get in.
answer: Found a use for me.

question: Yep. I gotta vanish, Mitch. I need money, a whole bunch.
answer: Why didn't you say so? Gimme a second while I pull it out of my ass.

question: The key, Mitch. The one I keep around my neck.
answer: What about it?

question: What if I told you it's the key to Box 406 at Pittsburgh International Airport?
answer: How would you know? Someone filed off the numbers.

question: Not someone. Me. I filed them off. There's a briefcase in Box 406, Mitch.
answer: What's in it?

question: $200,000. Payment for my last assignment. I need you to retrieve it for me.
answer: Why me?

question: Don't be stupid, they might have the place covered. I don't want to get shot to pieces.
answer: Shoulda known. Gimme the key.

question: I'd love to. I left it with Caitlin back in Ohio.
answer: Humor me

question: I fell into a school of fish, they elected me principal. Shut the fuck up.
answer: Mmmm. Personally...? I'm thinking maybe Samantha Caine wasn't an act. Maybe you forgot to hate yourself for eight years, ever think of that...?

question: Shut. The. Fuck. Up. Hmmm... Nope, seems clear enough to me. Hate myself, Christ almighty. What are you, my shrink?
answer: No, just some loser thought he could maybe understand, fuck it. I been there, you know. I'd kill for fucking amnesia. I'm with my boy and all I can think is I got reamed in the ass by three guys. Merry Christmas, son, here's a ball glove, did you know Daddy screamed when they carved the name in his back...? Mary, by the way. I pushed for Cindy, but hell. God, I'm tired. I never did one thing right, you know it, not one fucking thing. Not even accidental, that takes skill.

question: Drive past, don't slow down. Park under those trees, honk if there's trouble.
answer: Yas, massah, I be slowin' de caw down fo' you.

question: Phil...? Phil Krauss? I don't believe it, they moved you from cyphers. Long time, man, I figured you were dead by now. So, Mitch. Still think I'm warm and fuzzy?
answer: Sure. It's not your fault the gun accidentally went off in mid-air as you tripped and flew over the car.

question: Exactly. What's in the glove box?
answer: Phone bill, Christmas card... Five buck, swell. You didn't have to kill him, you know.

question: What the hell was that?
answer: He's got the kid. Doesn't want to talk on the airwaves, he's routing me to a land line. A pay phone.

question: Which phone? Where? Shit. Service centers...! They list 'em on the back of phone bills, right?
answer: Excuse me?

question: Shut up and find me a gun. HK, MP-5.
answer: Verify you have her.

question: Verify you have her.
answer: I got your cellular number off a cast on her right wrist. Right below Mommy loves you... Picture of a panda. Dog, panda, it's got funky ears. I want money, Charly. I know you've got numbered accounts, we all do. I'll let you know where and when. Fuck with me...? I'll blind the kid and shoot out her knees.

question: You're dead, motherfucker. We don't involve families. It's not the way it's done, *we don't take families*.
answer: I'll be in touch.

question: Give me an ANI trace. Do it.
answer: It's done, she hooked. All I gotta do is set the ransom meet.

question: It's done, she hooked. All I gotta do is set the ransom meet.
answer: She mustn't suspect a trap.

question: No way. She thinks I'm acting alone, remember? Say the word, I'll hand her to you on a plate.
answer: God. We're monsters, aren't we...? Forget Charly. Talk to me about tonight.

question: The tanker's on its way from Charleston, ETA 1:00 a.m. One terrorist on ice, waiting to play patsy. What's in the sack?
answer: That...? Something to prove that I'm not a complete ogre. See? The young one will have a doll to play with on Christmas. Very popular item. It... well, it pees. You put water in it and... oh, fuck you.

question: Almost dark now.
answer: Another ten minutes. You want my Crazy Meal action figure?

question: Pass. Listen, you sure we're doing the right thing? We've got money, we could negotiate...
answer: *I'll get the damn kid*, okay? God, I hope he doesn't shoot her up. Kid's dead weight if she's sedated.

question: Not so emotional, I'm getting embarrassed with these outbursts here.
answer: Oh, balls. Want me to cry on cue? I can. This is an extraction, nimrod, and she's the target, that's how to play it, the only way to beat this guy.

question: Yeah? How come you know so much about this fucking guy?
answer: Don't go there, Mitch, you don't want to know.

question: I'm here. Suppose you tell me.
answer: Fine, you asked. I bumped pelvises with this guy. In Paris, back in I'd been assigned to kill his boss, remember...? Needed him out of the way. So I let him seduce me. Had a steel needle under the pillow, figured to stick him *en flagrante*, that means while we were screwing. But he was too slick. Bashed me in the head, finished, then threw me in the trunk of a car. Still think I'm a girl scout, Mitch...? It's almost dark. Let's get it done.

question: What's the matter?
answer: They're here.

question: Who?
answer: Fucking Chapter, that's who. Timothy acting alone, Caitlin had a chance. Now...? She's dead meat.

question: Let me go in.
answer: Negative. You stomp around like a forties drunk and you're a lousy shot.

question: I get by.
answer: You couldn't hit a lake if you were standing on the bottom, now shut the fuck up. I saw a little girl.

question: Come again?
answer: That's what happened under the water. That night, eight years ago. At the end... there she was, this pretty little girl at the bottom of the ocean, smiling at me. Three years old, didn't know Daddies hid in closets, not yet. Stared up at me in the strangest way... saying how'd it come to this, we were so pretty and perfect, now look at us, sinking with our head all open... Said when she grew up she was gonna teach school. She couldn't wait. Guards are on 27-1 megahertz, meet me at 26-9, you need to talk. As soon as you spot me with the kid, start blowing the charges. They're gonna blow my head off, you know. This is the last time I'll ever be pretty. Time now. What I do next, they tell me it... looks like a machine or something. You don't like it, don't look. Don't say it.

question: I was gonna say enjoy life, eat out more often.
answer: Gotta go. If she's alive, she's coming out of there, Mitch. If she's not... they'll know we stopped by.

question: You know, Colonel, you ought really to have stayed dead. You don't know the rules of the game anymore.
answer: No shit. Eight years ago, you send me to kill Daedalus and this clown. Now you're working *with* him.

question: Budget cuts, remember? Congress blinded us in Eastern Europe, Central America. Across the board, an intelligence blackout. We had to recruit any eyes and ears we could find, even if it meant going to former targets.
answer: Budget cuts... oh, God. Is *that* what this is about...? The foot soldiers, the tanker truck... Fuck me, you're running a fundraiser!! You'll get all the money you want at the next budget hearing, won't you...? All you need is a major terrorist incident.

question: Interesting theory.
answer: Theory, my ass. I think some terrorists were planning a strike. Bought supplies from Daedalus, that's how you knew they were coming... No way. Don't tell me you're gonna sit there and let them go through with it, *just to get a budget increase*.

question: It's not without precedent. 1993, remember the World Trade Center bombing...? The CIA had advance knowledge, don't think they didn't. Worse, the diplomat who issued the terrorist's visa was CIA, they *facilitated* the bombing. Purely to justify a budget increase. Of course, they'd no way of knowing the terrorists would botch the job.
answer: That's not gonna happen this time...?

question: Easy, Mitch. How you gonna blame it on terrorists?
answer: Those roads are treacherous this time of year. When we dump a car to the bottom of a ravine, with the corpse of Imn Al Rahman in it... get the picture?

question: Listen to me, Timothy. Please. Let my kid go.
answer: Why? For old times' sake...?

question: Goddamn you, *look at her eyes*...
answer: And why exactly should I do that...?

question: Because they're yours, motherfucker. That night in Paris, I got pregnant. The little girl's your daughter.
answer: Priceless. Can't believe it... Kid's down there. What it is, Charly, they're gonna find you both frozen to death in the woods. Suicide pact.

question: She's no risk, Timothy, *let her go*.
answer: The freezer's downstairs, Charly. Let's get it done.

question: We're going to take a nap together, Cate. You can have your dolly, and Mommy will be next to you, how's that? It'll be like bears in winter. When they get cold, see, they fall deep, deep asleep...
answer: Bears, yeah, yeah. Enough.

question: You're murdering us both, cocksucker, let the kid have her fucking dolly.
answer: Chuck, I'm not a total creep. I'll make you a deal, okay? There's a knife in that box. Now, you and the kid, you're going to freeze, *but* -- if you kill the kid *by your own hand*...? I won't kill your husband. Serious. We're gonna open that door and you'll both be frozen solid, but I wanna know that you've cut your own child's throat.

question: Tell me where Charly keeps her money. She must have mentioned it.
answer: Get fucked, you dumb bastard. Charly called Washington, by morning this whole place'll be crawling with Feds.

question: We'll be gone by then, Mitch.
answer: Yeah, well, that's what I'm saying, there's a couple Feds, they couldn't sleep, said they might come early. Fuck you, someone'll screw up. Just watch.

question: Already did, Mitch, someone already did. Perkins got stuck with a double agent, someone trusted, highly placed.
answer: Who?

question: Me. Chinks are paying me to bring down Chapter. Truck goes, hundreds dead -- rescue teams within minutes, guess what they find...?
answer: The patsy.

question: Open. Gimme a spark... show me, show me... Come on, come on... do it...! All this, just one fucking match, *Goddamit*...!
answer: Mommy...? Don't cry. I keep these here. For lighting your candle.

question: I love you, Caitlin, oh God, do you know how much I love you...?
answer: Am I gonna die...?

question: *Run, Catey*. Where'd you go, baby... show Mommy... Smart girl, honey. Stay still. Don't make a sound. Snug as a bug in a rug...
answer: Charly, you there? Hello, Charly.

question: Mitch! I don't believe it. Listen, if you say, "Are we having fun yet" I'll rip your nuts off. Where are you?
answer: Behind the big garage. Is Caitlin with you?

question: No, but she's safe for the moment, she stowed away on the tanker truck.
answer: Charly, Timothy rigged the tanker to go off early. We got fifteen minutes. No more. Hello...! Charly...?

question: Tires won't pop, Mitch. Bastard just locked her in, she's stuck in there and they're leaving, *Goddammit*!
answer: All right, I'll go in and get her, you watch my back.

question: No chance. I make it twelve, Mitch, automatic weapons.
answer: So kill 'em for me, bitch, Christ, what are you good for? C'mon, buddy. Do one thing right, just this once... please... Piece of cake.

question: *Your nine, on your nine*! *30 degrees left, Mitch. Left*. *Your other left*. *Nix, nix, I can't see in there, don't do it, break right...*! *Fuck me, I was wrong, get outta threre*!
answer: Gracias.

question: *De nada*. *End run, Mitch, go wide*! *No, Goddamn you, they got you flanked...*!
answer: Dear Ma

question: I tried to give you a pretty death, baby. Did my best. Now you're fucked, now it's ground beef time.
answer: The truck. How long til it blows?

question: Sweet Loretta, you're another animal entirely. Let's see, 312 degrees... Make it ten minutes, give or take.
answer: Then I better hurry.

question: Oh, spare me. You made a big noise and bought five more minutes on the planet. Give up. Die. I'll spit in what's left of your face. All units converge. Divert local law, this is a government matter. Brook no interference, I want the Baltimore woman eliminated. *Where's the fucking chopper*?
answer: I'm the Missus. Drive.

question: You've lost a step, Chuck. Muscles never recovered from C-section, I'll bet. Am I right?
answer: Please, man... She's only... eight... she's a beautiful little girl...

question: She's a worthless bitch. I know it 'cause she came out of me. It's called shock, Charly... Your body wants to go into shock...
answer: Fuck you, your breathing's lousy...

question: Look at you. You're out of your motherfucking league, dearie.
answer: ...You want a piece...? Take my shoulder. *Cover your ears*.

question: ...You want a piece...? Take my shoulder. *Cover your ears*.
answer: MOMMY...!

question: Run... get out...
answer: Don't go away again, Please...!

question: The truck's a bomb... gonna blow up, RUN... I'm right behind you, go... ...*Go and don't look back*...
answer: *Mommy, no...*! It's okay. I'm sorry I left, please wake up, come on please...

question: Sorry, can't drive... Are you okay...?
answer: ...Are you... stupid...?

question: ...funny thing...? You aren't going to die... I am...
answer: I know.

question: Good morning, I'm Charly. The slab you're standing on is actually a land mine. Keep your foot on the pressure plate, nothing happens. Step off the stone, we'll all be wearing you.
answer: Charly, I know we've treated you poorly, please, it was just business --

question: My terms are these. Call State and order full disclosure on your personal correspondence. Then disband Chapter, effective immediately. In exchange...? I won't shoot you, and I won't make you stand on that mine. I won't touch you. I won't touch you. I promise.
answer: You... you promise. It's done. Now, you promise... you won't shoot me... won't make me get on the mine...?

question: I promise.
answer: Goddamn you, I can't hold him... You bitch... YOU FUCKING BITCH...!
